final_answer:
The humor in the image stems from the juxtaposition of two different contexts of walking. On the left side, a smartwatch proudly shows a step count of 10,000 steps, encouraging the idea of fitness and exercise being achieved through walking. This is represented by the stick figure walking, commonly associated with a healthy lifestyle.

On the right side, there is a depiction of a prisoner in an orange jumpsuit walking alongside prison bars. This scene implies that the prisoner is also getting his steps in but under the very different context of incarceration. 

The text “YES, BUT” on top highlights the contrast, suggesting that while walking 10,000 steps might be a health goal, it’s humorously subverted when it’s the result of walking in a prison. The satire plays on the fitness culture and step-counting obsession, showing it in an unexpected and ironic setting.
